pages.title: Burnout
pages.text: The $(item)Rocks$() here are also well suited to making a slightly more specialized $(item)Furnace$(). In this furnace, combustion of fuels is incomplete, and will result in $(item)Ash$(). Under most circumstances, this would be of little use, but right now, $(item)Ash$() is an important ingredient for fighting the more harmful effects of the $(thing)Mist$().

pages.title: Using the Furnace
pages.text: The Foggy Furnace has two modes - determined by whether the Air Intake[1] is Open or Closed.$(br2)When it's $(l)Open$(), the $(item)Furnace$() will consume $(thing)Fuel$(), heating the furnace, and burning up the $(thing)fuel$() into $(item)Ash$().$(br2)With the intake $(l)Closed$(), fuel will not be consumed, and the furnace will instead smelt anything placed in it, consuming stored heat.

pages.title: Using the Furnace
pages.text: To ignite, use a $(item)Flint & Steel$() on it while Air Intake is $(l)Open$() (pictured), with any $(thing)Fuel$() inside
$(item)Rocks$() can found scattered on the surface, or collected by breaking $(item)Foggy Stone$().
